   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(op_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   26:          bsl_bsr/1,logical/1,t_not/1,relop_simple/1,relop/1,
   27:          complex_relop/1,unsafe_fusing/1,
   28:          range_tests/1,typed_relop/1]).
   29: 
   30: -import(lists, [foldl/3,flatmap/2]).
   31: 
   32: suite() ->
   33:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   34:      {timetrap, {minutes, 5}}].
   35: 
   36: all() ->
   37:     [bsl_bsr, logical, t_not, relop_simple, relop,
   38:      complex_relop, unsafe_fusing, range_tests, typed_relop].
   39: 
   40: %% Test the bsl and bsr operators.
   41: bsl_bsr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   42:     RawValues = [-16#8000009-2,-1,0,1,2,73,16#8000000,bad,[]],
   43: 
   44:     [bsl_bsr_const(V) || V <- RawValues],
   45: 
   46:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- RawValues],
   47:     %% Try to use less memory by splitting the cases
   48: 
   49:     Cases1 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsl'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   50:     N1 = length(Cases1),
   51:     run_test_module(Cases1, false),
   52: 
   53:     Cases2 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsr'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   54:     N2 = length(Cases2),
   55:     run_test_module(Cases2, false),
   56: 
   57:     {comment,integer_to_list(N1 + N2) ++ " cases"}.
   58: 
   59: %% Tests constant-argument optimizations in `bsl`/`bsr`
   60: bsl_bsr_const(A) ->
   61:     BSL = id('bsl'),
   62:     BSR = id('bsr'),
   63: 
   64:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(1, A)), (catch 1 bsl A)),
   65:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(3, A)), (catch 3 bsl A)),
   66:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(7, A)), (catch 7 bsl A)),
   67: 
   68:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 1)), (catch A bsl 1)),
   69:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 3)), (catch A bsl 3)),
   70:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 7)), (catch A bsl 7)),
   71: 
   72:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsl A)),
   73:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsl A)),
   74:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsl A)),
   75: 
   76:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -2)), (catch A bsl -2)),
   77:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -4)), (catch A bsl -4)),
   78:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -8)), (catch A bsl -8)),
   79: 
   80:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(1, A)), (catch 1 bsr A)),
   81:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(3, A)), (catch 3 bsr A)),
   82:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(7, A)), (catch 7 bsr A)),
   83: 
   84:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 1)), (catch A bsr 1)),
   85:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 3)), (catch A bsr 3)),
   86:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 7)), (catch A bsr 7)),
   87: 
   88:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsr A)),
   89:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsr A)),
   90:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsr A)),
   91: 
   92:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -2)), (catch A bsr -2)),
   93:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -4)), (catch A bsr -4)),
   94:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -8)), (catch A bsr -8)),
   95: 
   96: 
   97:     %% These numbers can be shifted left one or zero times while remaining a
   98:     %% small on 32-bit platforms.
   99:     %%
  100:     %% The test relies on the compiler turning these into constants.
  101:     HighEdge32 = (1 bsl (32 - 6)) - 1,
  102:     LowEdge32 = -(1 bsl (32 - 6)),
  103: 
  104:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsl A)),
  105:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsl A)),
  106:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsr A)),
  107:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsr A)),
  108: 
  109:     HighEdge64 = (1 bsl (64 - 6)) - 1,
  110:     LowEdge64 = -(1 bsl (64 - 6)),
  111: 
  112:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsl A)),
  113:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsl A)),
  114:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsr A)),
  115:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsr A)),
  116: 
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: bsl_bsr_compare_results(Same, Same) ->
  120:     ok;
  121: bsl_bsr_compare_results({'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}, {'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}) ->
  122:     %% The applied and inlined implementations may differ in whether they include
  123:     %% the operator as the top element of the stack.
  124:     ok.
  125: 
  126: %% Test the logical operators and internal BIFs.
  127: logical(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  128:     Vs0 = [true,false,bad],
  129:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  130:     Cases = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['and','or','xor'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
  131:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  132:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  133: 
  134: %% Test the not operator and internal BIFs.
  135: t_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     Cases = [{'not',unvalue(V)} || V <- [true,false,42,bad]],
  137:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  138:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  139: 
  140: %% Test that simlpe relations between relation operators hold.
  141: relop_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  142:     Big1 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  143:     Big2 = 38374938373887374983978484,
  144:     F1 = float(Big1),
  145:     F2 = float(Big2),
  146:     T1 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  147:     T2 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  148:     Terms = [-F2,Big2,-F1,-Big1,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,42,42.0,Big1,F1,Big2,F2,a,b,
  149:              {T1,a},{T2,b},[T1,Big1],[T2,Big2]],
  150: 
  151:     Combos = [{V1,V2} || V1 <- Terms, V2 <- Terms],
  152: 
  153:     lists:foreach(fun({A,B}) -> relop_simple_do(A,B) end,
  154:                   Combos),
  155: 
  156:     repeat(fun() ->
  157:                    Size = rand:uniform(100),
  158:                    Rnd1 = make_rand_term(Size),
  159:                    {Rnd2,0} = clone_and_mutate(Rnd1, rand:uniform(Size)),
  160:                    relop_simple_do(Rnd1,Rnd2)
  161:            end,
  162:            1000),
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: relop_simple_do(V1,V2) ->
  166:     %%io:format("compare ~p\n   and  ~p\n",[V1,V2]),
  167: 
  168:     L = V1 < V2,
  169:     L = not (V1 >= V2),
  170:     L = V2 > V1,
  171:     L = not (V2 =< V1),
  172: 
  173:     G = V1 > V2,
  174:     G = not (V1 =< V2),
  175:     G = V2 < V1,
  176:     G = not (V2 >= V1),
  177: 
  178:     ID = V1 =:= V2,
  179:     ID = V2 =:= V1,
  180:     ID = not (V1 =/= V2),
  181:     ID = not (V2 =/= V1),
  182: 
  183:     EQ = V1 == V2,
  184:     EQ = V2 == V1,
  185:     EQ = not (V1 /= V2),
  186:     EQ = not (V2 /= V1),
  187: 
  188:     case {L, EQ, ID, G, cmp_emu(V1,V2)} of
  189:         { true, false, false, false, -1} -> ok;
  190:         {false, true,  false, false,  0} -> ok;
  191:         {false, true,   true, false,  0} -> ok;
  192:         {false, false, false, true,  +1} -> ok
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: %% Emulate internal "cmp"
  196: cmp_emu(A,B) when is_tuple(A), is_tuple(B) ->
  197:     SA = size(A),
  198:     SB = size(B),
  199:     if SA =:= SB -> cmp_emu(tuple_to_list(A),tuple_to_list(B));
  200:        SA > SB -> +1;
  201:        SA < SB -> -1
  202:     end;
  203: cmp_emu([A|TA],[B|TB]) ->
  204:     case cmp_emu(A,B) of
  205:         0   -> cmp_emu(TA,TB);
  206:         CMP -> CMP
  207:     end;
  208: cmp_emu(A,B) ->
  209:     %% We cheat and use real "cmp" for the primitive types.
  210:     if A < B -> -1;
  211:        A > B -> +1;
  212:        true -> 0
  213:     end.					              
  214: 
  215: make_rand_term(1) ->
  216:     make_rand_term_single();
  217: make_rand_term(Arity) ->
  218:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  219:         1 ->
  220:             make_rand_list(Arity);
  221:         2 ->
  222:             list_to_tuple(make_rand_list(Arity));
  223:         3 ->
  224:             {Car,Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  225:             [Car|make_rand_term(Rest)]
  226:     end.
  227: 
  228: make_rand_term_single() ->
  229:     Range = 1 bsl rand:uniform(200),
  230:     case rand:uniform(12) of
  231:         1 -> random;
  232:         2 -> uniform;
  233:         3 -> rand:uniform(Range) - (Range div 2);
  234:         4 -> Range * (rand:uniform() - 0.5);
  235:         5 -> 0;
  236:         6 -> 0.0;
  237:         7 -> make_ref();
  238:         8 -> self();
  239:         9 -> term_to_binary(rand:uniform(Range));
  240:         10 -> fun(X) -> X*Range end; 
  241:         11 -> fun(X) -> X/Range end;
  242:         12 -> []
  243:     end.	    
  244: 
  245: make_rand_term_rand_size(1) ->
  246:     {make_rand_term(1), 0};
  247: make_rand_term_rand_size(MaxArity) ->
  248:     Arity = rand:uniform(MaxArity-1),
  249:     {make_rand_term(Arity), MaxArity-Arity}.
  250: 
  251: make_rand_list(0) -> [];
  252: make_rand_list(Arity) ->
  253:     {Term, Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  254:     [Term | make_rand_list(Rest)].
  255: 
  256: 
  257: clone_and_mutate(Term, 0) ->
  258:     {clone(Term), 0};
  259: clone_and_mutate(_Term, 1) ->
  260:     {Mutation, _} = make_rand_term_rand_size(10), % MUTATE!
  261:     {Mutation, 0};
  262: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) when is_tuple(Term) ->
  263:     {Clone,NewCnt} = clone_and_mutate(tuple_to_list(Term),Cnt),
  264:     {my_list_to_tuple(Clone), NewCnt};
  265: clone_and_mutate([Term|Tail], Cnt) ->
  266:     {Car,Cnt1} = clone_and_mutate(Term,Cnt),
  267:     {Cdr,Cnt2} = clone_and_mutate(Tail,Cnt1),
  268:     {[Car | Cdr], Cnt2};
  269: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) ->
  270:     {clone(Term), Cnt-1}.
  271: 
  272: clone(Term) ->
  273:     binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)).
  274: 
  275: my_list_to_tuple(List) ->
  276:     try list_to_tuple(List)
  277:     catch
  278:         error:badarg -> 
  279:             %%io:format("my_list_to_tuple got badarg exception.\n"),
  280:             list_to_tuple(purify_list(List))
  281:     end.
  282: 
  283: purify_list(List) ->
  284:     lists:reverse(purify_list(List, [])).
  285: purify_list([], Acc) -> Acc;
  286: purify_list([H|T], Acc) -> purify_list(T, [H|Acc]);
  287: purify_list(Other, Acc) -> [Other|Acc].
  288: 
  289: 
  290: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on literals.
  291: relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     Big1 = -38374938373887374983978484,
  293:     Big2 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  294:     F1 = float(Big1),
  295:     F2 = float(Big2),
  296:     Vs0 = [a,b,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,42,42.0,Big1,Big2,F1,F2],
  297:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  298:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  299:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  300: 
  301: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on lists and tuples.
  302: complex_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  303:     Big = 99678557475484872464269855544643333,
  304:     Float = float(Big),
  305:     Vs0 = [an_atom,42.0,42,Big,Float],
  306:     Vs = flatmap(fun(X) -> [unvalue({X}),unvalue([X])] end, Vs0),
  307:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  308:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  309: 
  310: binop(Ops, Vs) ->
  311:     Run = fun(Op, N) -> Cases = [{Op,V1,V2} || V1 <- Vs, V2 <- Vs],
  312:                         run_test_module(Cases, true),
  313:                         N + length(Cases) end,
  314:     NumCases = foldl(Run, 0, Ops),
  315:     {comment,integer_to_list(NumCases) ++ " cases"}.
  316: 
  317: run_test_module(Cases, GuardsOk) ->
  318:     Es = [expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  319:     Ok = unvalue(ok),
  320:     Gts = case GuardsOk of
  321:               true ->
  322:                   Ges = [guard_expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  323:                   lists:foldr(fun guard_test/2, [Ok], Ges);
  324:               false ->
  325:                   [Ok]
  326:           end,
  327:     Fun1 = make_function(guard_tests, Gts),
  328:     Bts = lists:foldr(fun body_test/2, [Ok], Es),
  329:     Fun2 = make_function(body_tests, Bts),
  330:     Bbts = lists:foldr(fun internal_bif/2, [Ok], Es),
  331:     Fun3 = make_function(bif_tests, Bbts),
  332:     Id = {function,1,id,1,[{clause,1,[{var,1,'I'}],[],[{var,1,'I'}]}]},
  333:     Module0 = make_module(op_tests, [Fun1,Fun2,Fun3,Id]),
  334:     Module = erl_parse:new_anno(Module0),
  335:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> io:put_chars([erl_pp:form(F),"\n"]) end, Module),
  336: 
  337:     %% Compile, load, and run the generated module. Test both with and
  338:     %% without compiler optimizations to ensure that we test both the
  339:     %% implementation of the BIFs and the BEAM instructions.
  340:     do_run_test_module(Module, []),
  341:     do_run_test_module(Module, [no_copt,no_ssa_opt,no_postopt]).
  342: 
  343: do_run_test_module(Module, Opts) ->
  344:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:forms(Module, [time|Opts]),
  345:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  346:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  347: 
  348:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code1),
  349: 
  350:     run_function(Mod, guard_tests),
  351:     run_function(Mod, body_tests),
  352:     run_function(Mod, bif_tests),
  353: 
  354:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  355:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  356: 
  357:     ok.
  358: 
  359: expr({Op,X}) ->
  360:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]}},
  361:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X}]),
  362:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  363: expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  364:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]},Y},
  365:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X,Y}]),
  366:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  367: 
  368: guard_expr({Op,X}) ->
  369:     E = {op,1,Op,X},
  370:     Res = eval([E]),
  371:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  372: guard_expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  373:     E = {op,1,Op,X,Y},
  374:     Res = eval([E]),
  375:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  376: 
  377: run_function(Mod, Name) ->
  378:     case catch Mod:Name() of
  379:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
  380:             io:format("~p", [get(last)]),
  381:             ct:fail({'EXIT',Reason});
  382:         _Other ->
  383:             ok
  384:     end.
  385: 
  386: guard_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  387:     True = unvalue(true),
  388:     [save_term(Expr),
  389:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  390:       {'if',1,[{clause,1,[],[[E]],[True]},
  391:                {clause,1,[],[[True]],[unvalue(false)]}]}}|Tail].
  392: 
  393: body_test({E,Expr,{'EXIT',_}}, Tail) ->
  394:     [save_term(Expr),
  395:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  396:       {'catch',1,E}}|Tail];
  397: body_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  398:     [save_term(Expr),
  399:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),E}|Tail].
  400: 
  401: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  402:     internal_bif(Op, [X], Expr, Res, Tail);
  403: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X,Y},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  404:     internal_bif(Op, [X,Y], Expr, Res, Tail).
  405: 
  406: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, {'EXIT',_}, Tail) ->
  407:     [save_term(Expr),
  408:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  409:       {'catch',1,{call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}}|Tail];
  410: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, Res, Tail) ->
  411:     [save_term(Expr),
  412:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  413:       {call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}|Tail].
  414: 
  415: save_term(Term) ->
  416:     {call,1,
  417:      {atom,1,put},
  418:      [{atom,1,last},unvalue(Term)]}.
  419: 
  420: make_module(Name, Funcs) ->
  421:     [{attribute,1,module,Name},
  422:      {attribute,0,compile,export_all} |
  423:      Funcs ++ [{eof,0}]].
  424: 
  425: make_function(Name, Body) ->
  426:     {function,1,Name,0,[{clause,1,[],[],Body}]}.
  427: 
  428: eval(E0) ->
  429:     E = erl_parse:new_anno(E0),
  430:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(E, []) of
  431:         {'EXIT',Reason} -> {'EXIT',Reason};
  432:         {value,Val,_Bs} -> Val
  433:     end.
  434: 
  435: unsafe_fusing(_Config) ->
  436:     0 = usec_to_seconds(id(1)),
  437:     234_567 = usec_to_seconds(id(1_234_567_890*1_000)),
  438:     ok.
  439: 
  440: usec_to_seconds(Usec) when is_integer(Usec) ->
  441:     %% The introduction of typed operands caused the loader
  442:     %% to incorrectly fuse the following instrutions because
  443:     %% the result register ({x,0}) from the 'div' instruction
  444:     %% seemed to be distinct from both operands of the 'rem'
  445:     %% instruction:
  446:     %%
  447:     %% {gc_bif,'div',
  448:     %%         {f,0},
  449:     %%         1,
  450:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  451:     %%         {x,0}}.
  452:     %% {gc_bif,'rem',
  453:     %%         {f,0},
  454:     %%         1,
  455:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  456:     %%         {x,0}}.
  457:     Sec = Usec div 1000000,
  458:     Sec rem 1000000.
  459: 
  460: range_tests(_Config) ->
  461:     %% Define the limits for smalls on a 64-bit system.
  462:     {MinSmall, MaxSmall} = {-1 bsl 59, (1 bsl 59) - 1},
  463:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  464:         8 ->
  465:             %% Assertions.
  466:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall-1),
  467:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall),
  468:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall),
  469:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall+1);
  470:         4 ->
  471:             ok
  472:     end,
  473: 
  474:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  475:     lesser = range(MinSmall),
  476:     lesser = range(0),
  477:     lesser = range(-1),
  478:     lesser = range(0.9999),
  479: 
  480:     inside = range_any(1),
  481:     inside = range_any(2),
  482:     inside = range_any(2.5),
  483:     inside = range_any(math:pi()),
  484:     inside = range_any(5),
  485:     inside = range_any(9),
  486:     inside = range_any(10),
  487: 
  488:     greater = range(10.0001),
  489:     greater = range(11),
  490:     greater = range(MaxSmall),
  491:     greater = range(1 bsl 64),
  492:     greater = range(atom),
  493:     greater = range(self()),
  494:     greater = range(make_ref()),
  495:     greater = range({a,b}),
  496:     greater = range([a,b]),
  497:     greater = range([]),
  498:     greater = range(<<1,2,3>>),
  499:     greater = range(fun() -> ok end),
  500:     greater = range(fun ?MODULE:range_tests/1),
  501: 
  502:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  503:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  504:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  505:     lesser = range_barely_small(MinSmall - 1),
  506: 
  507:     inside = range_barely_small(MinSmall),
  508:     inside = range_barely_small(-1 bsl 58),
  509:     inside = range_barely_small(0),
  510:     inside = range_barely_small(17.75),
  511:     inside = range_barely_small(1 bsl 58),
  512:     inside = range_barely_small(MaxSmall),
  513: 
  514:     greater = range_barely_small(MaxSmall + 1),
  515:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  516:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  517:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  518: 
  519:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  520:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  521:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  522: 
  523:     inside = range_big(MinSmall),
  524:     inside = range_big(-1 bsl 58),
  525:     inside = range_big(0),
  526:     inside = range_barely_small(17.75),
  527:     inside = range_big(1 bsl 58),
  528:     inside = range_big(MaxSmall),
  529: 
  530:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  531:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  532:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  533: 
  534:     ok.
  535: 
  536: range(X) ->
  537:     Res = range_any(X),
  538:     if
  539:         is_integer(X) ->
  540:             Res = range_any(float(X)),
  541:             Res = range_number(X),
  542:             Res = range_number(float(X)),
  543:             Res = range_int(X),
  544:             if
  545:                 X =:= X band 16#ffff ->
  546:                     Res = range_small_int(X);
  547:                 true ->
  548:                     Res
  549:             end;
  550:         is_number(X) ->
  551:             Res = range_number(X);
  552:         true ->
  553:             Res = range_big(X),
  554:             Res = range_barely_small(X)
  555:     end.
  556: 
  557: range_any(X0) ->
  558:     X = id(X0),
  559:     case range_any_1(X) of
  560:         inside ->
  561:             inside = range_any_2(X);
  562:         Other ->
  563:             outside = range_any_2(X),
  564:             Other
  565:     end.
  566: 
  567: %% The guard tests have different failure labels.
  568: range_any_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  569:     inside;
  570: range_any_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  571:     lesser;
  572: range_any_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  573:     greater.
  574: 
  575: %% The guard tests have the same failure label.
  576: range_any_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  577:     inside;
  578: range_any_2(_) ->
  579:     outside.
  580: 
  581: range_number(X) when is_number(X) ->
  582:     case range_number_1(X) of
  583:         inside ->
  584:             inside = range_number_2(X);
  585:         Other ->
  586:             outside = range_number_2(X),
  587:             Other
  588:     end.
  589: 
  590: range_number_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  591:     inside;
  592: range_number_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  593:     lesser;
  594: range_number_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  595:     greater.
  596: 
  597: range_number_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  598:     inside;
  599: range_number_2(_) ->
  600:     outside.
  601: 
  602: range_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  603:     case range_int_1(X) of
  604:         inside ->
  605:             inside = range_int_2(X);
  606:         Other ->
  607:             outside = range_int_2(X),
  608:             Other
  609:     end.
  610: 
  611: range_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  612:     inside;
  613: range_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  614:     lesser;
  615: range_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  616:     greater.
  617: 
  618: range_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  619:     inside;
  620: range_int_2(_) ->
  621:     outside.
  622: 
  623: range_small_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  624:     case range_small_int_1(X) of
  625:         inside ->
  626:             inside = range_small_int_2(X);
  627:         Other ->
  628:             outside = range_small_int_2(X),
  629:             Other
  630:     end.
  631: 
  632: range_small_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  633:     inside;
  634: range_small_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  635:     lesser;
  636: range_small_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  637:     greater.
  638: 
  639: range_small_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  640:     inside;
  641: range_small_int_2(_) ->
  642:     outside.
  643: 
  644: range_barely_small(X) ->
  645:     case range_barely_small_1(X) of
  646:         inside ->
  647:             inside = range_barely_small_2(X);
  648:         Other ->
  649:             outside = range_barely_small_2(X),
  650:             Other
  651:     end.
  652: 
  653: range_barely_small_1(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  654:     inside;
  655: range_barely_small_1(X) when X < -1 bsl 59 ->
  656:     lesser;
  657: range_barely_small_1(X) when X > (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  658:     greater.
  659: 
  660: range_barely_small_2(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  661:     inside;
  662: range_barely_small_2(_) ->
  663:     outside.
  664: 
  665: range_big(X) ->
  666:     case range_big_1(X) of
  667:         inside ->
  668:             inside = range_big_2(X);
  669:         Other ->
  670:             outside = range_big_2(X),
  671:             Other
  672:     end.
  673: 
  674: range_big_1(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  675:     inside;
  676: range_big_1(X) when X < (-1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  677:     lesser;
  678: range_big_1(X) when X > 1 bsl 59 ->
  679:     greater.
  680: 
  681: range_big_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  682:     inside;
  683: range_big_2(_) ->
  684:     outside.
  685: 
  686: %% Tests operators where type hints are significant.
  687: typed_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  688:     _ = [compare_integer_pid(1 bsl N) || N <- lists:seq(1, 64)],
  689:     ok.
  690: 
  691: compare_integer_pid(N) when is_integer(N) ->
  692:     Immed = self(),
  693:     true = is_pid(Immed),
  694:     if
  695:         N >= Immed -> ct:fail("integer compared greater than pid");
  696:         N < Immed -> ok
  697:     end.
  698: 
  699: %%%
  700: %%% Utilities.
  701: %%%
  702: 
  703: unvalue(V) ->
  704:     Abstr = erl_parse:abstract(V),
  705:     erl_parse:anno_to_term(Abstr).
  706: 
  707: value({nil,_}) -> [];
  708: value({integer,_,X}) -> X;
  709: value({string,_,X}) -> X;
  710: value({float,_,X})   -> X;
  711: value({atom,_,X})    -> X;
  712: value({tuple,_,Es}) ->
  713:     list_to_tuple(lists:map(fun(X) -> value(X) end, Es));
  714: value({cons,_,H,T}) ->
  715:     [value(H) | value(T)].
  716: 
  717: repeat(_, 0) -> ok;
  718: repeat(Fun, N) ->
  719:     Fun(),
  720:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
  721: 
  722: id(I) -> I.
